subject: Sales
title: Recency Bias in Decisions
description: A 60-second lesson on Recency Bias in Decisions.

hook.text: A buyer watches three demos. They pick the vendor who presented last. This happens more than you'd think.

buildup.text: Recency bias means the last thing we experience carries outsized weight in our decisions.

discovery.text: Judges, interviewers, and buyers all overweight recent information. Memory fades fast.

twist.text: Going last isn't always possible. The alternative: make your message so vivid it outlasts the rest.

climax.text: Follow up right before the decision date. Refresh your story so it's freshest in their mind.

punchline.text: The last impression often wins the deal.
